title: South Live: Monday 15 January - BBC News
summary: company involved in hs2 high-speed rail link to go into liquidation .
firefighters on standby to deliver meals after firm 's collapse .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thank you for joining us today .
we will be back with all of the region 's latest news , travel and sport tomorrow at 08:00 .

documents.title: hampshire respite care homes to close despite protests
text: two residential care homes in hampshire for children with disabilities are to shut following a council review .
merrydale in winchester and sunbeams in aldershot offer breaks for 35 families caring for profoundly disabled children .
campaigners had described the services as a `` lifeline '' for families .
the council insisted alternatives were more cost effective and it would provide a `` wider choice of options '' for support .
`` there are substantial costs associated with keeping these buildings and facilities up to standard and fit for purpose , and it is my view that this money can be put to better use .

while i acknowledge that some of those families will be disappointed with this decision , i am confident that they will be able to agree , with their social worker , a new and alternative package of respite care that will continue to meet their particular needs , ''

documents.title: hundreds of mourners to attend pc funeral
text: about 500 mourners will attend the funeral of pc james dixon in pangbourne , berkshire , on thursday , police have said .
the 39-year-old officer , who appeared in sky tv programme road wars , died in a crash on the a4 bath road in wargrave on 5 december .
his motorcycle was involved in a collision with a car , in which 91-year-old passenger gladys goodwin died .
thames valley police is operating a park and ride service for officers attending the funeral , which will begin at 11:30 gmt at saint james the less church .

documents.title: council has 'no current contracts ' with carillion
text: dorset county council says it has `` no current contracts '' with construction giant carillion , which has gone into liquidation .
however the authority said three of its schools - queen elizabeth in wimborne , holy trinity primary in weymouth and lytchett minster school - had been subject to carillion contracts in the past .
`` due to the nature of the contracts , these schools had protection against latent defects for 12 years which may now be lost with the collapse of carillion , '' a spokesman said .
`` we are concerned with the potential impact this may have on carillion 's supply chain , which might include some of our contracted suppliers . ''

documents.title: howe delight at cherries ' 'famous win '
text: afc bournemouth came from behind to beat arsenal 2-1 in the premier league with two goals in five minutes at the vitality stadium on sunday .
manager eddie howe said the victory was a `` famous win '' .

documents.title: army set to bid farewell to lynx helicopter
text: the army is set to bid farewell to the lynx helicopter with a commemorative flight tomorrow
the aircraft is to be decommissioned after almost 40 years in service .
five remaining lynx are due to leave from raf odiham in hampshire on tuesday at 08:45 for an aerial tour taking in military bases and locations associated with the helicopter .
the flight will culminate in a v-shaped `` air procession '' along the river thames in central london .

the warning applies to the whole of the region until 18:00 gmt on wednesday .

however , the blustery and damp conditions are expected to return overnight with temperature falling to 6c ,

documents.title: te lawrence 's moreton grave site 'under threat ' due to quarry plans
text: the site of te lawrence 's grave is under threat from plans for three nearby quarries , campaigners have said .
woodsford quarry , near moreton , dorset , would be extended under the proposals , while new quarries would be created at station road and hurst farm .
frome residents against mineral extraction ( frame ) said the plans would see the grave 's churchyard setting `` utterly spoilt '' for visitors .
dorset county council has not yet responded to a bbc request for comment .

documents.title: 'the waves were as big as houses '
text: a tug boat captain , who was praised by the prime minister for `` averting a disaster '' when a cargo ship lost power off the dorset coast , has described the rescue operation .
theresa may praised rescue teams as crew of tug boat , kingston , tell their story of the dramatic events

documents.title: police investigating aldershot baby murder search for two people seen on cctv
text: cctv images have been released of two people seen near the scene of where a baby was born and later murdered .
the girl , known as baby m , was found dead in shrubbery at manor park , aldershot , on 19 may .
police said the two people in the footage walked up and down nearby ash road , where the baby is believed to have been born , 10 times in the space of an hour on the night of 15 may .

documents.title: park baby murder cctv footage released
text: the body of the newborn girl was found in bushes in a park in aldershot in may .

documents.title: 'very strong winds ' forecast for wednesday
text: the met office has issued a warning of `` very strong winds '' in the south of england on wednesday night and thursday morning .
the yellow warning says there may be power cuts , flying debris and large waves on western coasts .
road , rail and ferry services may also be affected , the met office says .

documents.title: pool closed for boiler repairs
text: meadway pool is temporarily closed today due to urgent boiler repair work .
we apologise for any inconvenience caused and will keep you updated on progress to reopen the pool .
# rdguk

documents.title: firefighters on standby to deliver meals
text: firefighters on standby to deliver meals

documents.title: reading council in bid to plug £ 43.2m funding gap
text: reading borough council is meeting tonight to make some difficult decisions about how to balance the books .
the council faces an estimated £ 43.2m shortfall by 2021 when government funding is completely removed .
it says it is fast running out of ways to generate extra revenue .
local authorities are allowed to raise council tax by 1 % without triggering a local referendum on the issue but in reading that would only raise around £ 1m .
now councillors will consider changes to children 's services and adult social care in an effort to cut costs .
council leader jo lovelock said : `` year upon year of underfunding of vital public services mean local councils continue to face increasingly unpalatable decisions . ''

documents.title: hotels fail child exploitation tests
text: some hotels in oxfordshire failed to act on signs of child exploitation , in the latest under-cover test by the police and councils .
six out of 12 hotels accepted a booking for a 14-year-old girl , with no identification , and a man in a double room .
the other six refused the booking in december but did not call the police .
the results were an improvement on tests in june , when nine out of 12 hotels accepted the booking .
the operation was run by thames valley police and south oxfordshire and vale of white horse district councils .

documents.title: man arrested over bowling green rape
text: a man has been arrested on sus of raping a woman at a bowling green in bournemouth .
police said the victim met a man in southcote road at about 23:30 gmt on new year 's eve and they walked to the green where `` sexual activity '' took place .
this was initially consensual but the man reportedly became violent and raped her , detectives said .
the suspect , a 21-year-old bournemouth man , has been released pending further inquiries .

documents.title: travel : rail delays easing after 'broken rail '
text: update 15/01 following reports of a suspected broken rail between brockenhurst and bournemouth all lines are now reopened .
residual delays expected until 12:00

documents.title: fire service on stand-by to deliver school meals
text: firefighters have been put on stand-by to deliver school meals in oxfordshire , following the collapse of service provider carillion .
the firm is to go into liquidation after losing money on big contracts and running up huge debts .
oxfordshire county council said it had taken over services provided by carillion , including meals in about 90 schools .
we expect school staff will be in work as normal today but if this does n't happen we will provide school lunches to schools needing support , and the fire service are on standby to deliver them .
we are confident no child will go hungry at school .

documents.title: crash lorry sheds paper and fuel on m3
text: crash lorry sheds paper and fuel on m3

documents.title: arrest after lorry overturns and sheds paper on m3
text: a driver has been arrested after a lorry containing about 20 tonnes of paper overturned .
about 150 litres ( 32 gallons ) of diesel also spilled over the road at junction 12 , for eastleigh , following the one-vehicle collision at about 21:30 gmt on sunday .
the crash barrier was also damaged .
a 50-year-old man has been arrested for failing to provide a specimen , hampshire constabulary said .
the road was fully reopened at about 07:45 gmt .

documents.title: the children learning how to handle debt
text: swaythling primary school in southampton has set up a money club for children aged five to nine .

documents.title: travel : rail line blocked
text: update due to a reported broken rail between brockenhurst and bournemouth , the bournemouth bound line is currently blocked , we are in the process of arranging replacement transport between brockenhurst and bournemouth .
please find updates here

documents.title: portsmouth restaurant delivers takeaway curry to france
text: an indian restaurant has chartered a private plane to deliver curry to 30 expats in france .
the 500-mile journey from lee-on-the-solent in hampshire to bordeaux was completed on saturday .
faz ahmed , from southsea 's akash restaurant , said they still honoured the business 's policy of free delivery on orders over £ 12 .

documents.title: travel : '90-minute delay ' on a3
text: an accident near queen elizabeth country park in hampshire is causing long northbound delays on the a3 and the a3 ( m ) .
# a3m/ # a3 northbound - delays still showing as about 90mins due to an rtc near the qeii country park .
surrounding routes through # purbrook , # waterlooville , # cowplain and # clanfield very congested .

documents.title: travel : m3 'pretty miserable '
text: a broken-down vehicle is continuing to cause northbound delays on the m3 between winchester and eastleigh .
there is also a 30-minute delay on the southbound side .
the nearby b3354 is congested northbound between twyford and fair oak .
# m3 - pretty miserable still .
northbound very slow and all surrounding routes seeing a lot of extra traffic .
taking an hour through twyford from fair oak .
southbound m3 30min delay from j9 .

documents.title: former police officer owes £ 26,000 after cancer diagnosis
text: a former police officer who was diagnosed with terminal cancer has spoken of his despair after racking up debts of £ 26,000 .
mark harrigan , 55 , who lives in the new forest in hampshire , has been using credit cards to pay his day-to-day bills .
he says he never had money worries in the past but the debts piled up as he was unable to work .
according to research by macmillan cancer support , every year 400,000 people living with cancer struggle to keep up with their bills as a result of their diagnosis .
after mr harrigan spoke to the bbc , the credit card companies involved have written off the £ 26,000 he owed .
details of organisations offering information and support with debt are available at bbc.co.uk/actionline , or you can call free , at any time to hear recorded information on 08000 564 756 .
you can see more on inside out on bbc one in the south of england at 19:30 on monday .

documents.title: weather : wet and windy , frequent showers
text: sara thornton has monday 's forecast for the south of england .

documents.title: carillion to go into liquidation
text: construction giant carillion is to take steps to go into liquidation , threatening thousands of jobs .
the move came after discussions between carillion , its lenders and the government failed to reach a deal to save the company .
however , the government will provide funding to maintain the public services run by carillion .
the firm is involved in major projects like the hs2 high-speed rail line , which is expected to cross north east oxfordshire .

documents.title: headlines : carillion to enter liquidation
text: headlines : carillion to enter liquidation

documents.title: biker dies after meon valley crash
text: a 40-year-old man has died after his motorbike crashed on the a272 in the meon valley , hampshire .
the rider of the green kawasaki bike died at the scene near west meon yesterday afternoon .
police have said they do n't believe any other vehicles were involved but are appealing for people who saw the bike being ridden in that area before the crash to come forward .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to bbc south live .
we will bring you the latest headlines from across the region along with sport , travel and weather updates until 18:00 .
you can get in touch with us using our hampshire , dorset , berkshire and oxford facebook pages , or via our twitter accounts : @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
